column3: Thanks Luke, I didn't know about abort. Fixed.\n

Thanks for the suggestion, @luke-jr. I've updated the PR to use uiInterface.ThreadSafeMessageBox which is the logging function used for other failures in init.cpp, and also added a URL to a wiki page describing the problem and available workarounds.\n

Instead of deferring this to the last moment and create a dependency of the key.c/h on UI interface, I'd prefer adding this check (and potentially other sanity checks, see #4081) earlier in the init sequence, for example in AppInit2 before any key objects are instantiated.\n

Ok, I've refreshed the PR; I left the assertion in place and added an InitSanityCheck function to init.cpp which does the check. The failure is now both clean and immediate (the old assertion failure took several seconds to trigger on my machine). The function InitSanityCheck is also a clear place to add the additional checks suggested in #4081.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/4a09e1df51267c6d2dec219c6f96a24b716cc251 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
Oh, I should probably mention that I've tested this (and every candidate along the way) with a good and bad OpenSSL library. It works correctly in both cases.\n
Code changes look good to me.\n
Should probably use the logging functions... Maybe explain a bit about how the user may consider solving it?\n
